title: Good to know Riot cares about us!
body:
If someone says anything along the lines of "kys" "dogshit worthless subhumans" "how are your lives worth anything" they are perfectly fine. Riot won't ban them!

If someone finds a way to contact you outside the game Riot won't do anything about them!

Also if you threaten to dox someone it's fine too. In fact if you're the person that's being threatened and they actually do dox you. You might as well sit back and accept it because Riot won't give 2 shits. (^.^)

I don't care if someone opens a ticket pissed off as all hell. If you see that a player is saying that another player said some shit like this you sure as hell don't respond with "Because of the nonconstructive nature of your ticket, I will have to close it out. We are always happy to help, but we will ask that you be constructive for us to do so." Even if that player is the biggest dickhead in the world allegations like this should be taken seriously not pushed off because your feelings are hurt.

Fact is Riot could ban players like this permanently however, they choose not to because they are nothing more than a money hungry company.

So, Riot will you delete this post or actually do something about this bullshit? (^.^)

replies.body:
Only reason it would be deleted would be due to the Rant like nature. However, if you are actually looking to discuss this, you should be fine.

To start with. You are flat out incorrect in many of your statements. You examples are punishable and have been punished before. Check the forums and you will find cases of people banned for saying "kys". The others may not be zero tolerance, but would still contribute to a punishment.

If your ticket got closed, it is more likely you either were spamming the system or foaming at the mouth incoherently. If you reported in the post game lobby, you don't even need to go to submit a ticket.

Submitting a ticket has been recommended to me by Rioters for more serious issues, like if you suspect someone of boosting, and then they investigate that. One time I sort of indirectly got them to re-review a chat log for someone who was harassing me in a match, though they said they can't disclose the outcome to me.
Boosting is something that has to be reviewed by an actual person. Meanwhile, verbal cases can be handled by the ifs.

> [{quoted}](name=Imperial Pandaa,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=wFWzTdFJ,comment-id=000100000001,timestamp=2020-02-15T16:14:46.424+0000)

> Boosting is something that has to be reviewed by an actual person. Meanwhile, verbal cases can be handled by the ifs.

Verbal cases can be handled by their system. "If you believe there is more to a situation and requires context to distribute appropriate punishment you can open a ticket." - Riot

Basically a situation like this should be handled by a person not a computer.  Although even after that person "reviewed" it there is no punishment. Instead the pretty much told me to fuck off and try again. When I make an allegation like this. It's not something you push off. It's something you should look into.

Riot bans accounts, not players. So, strictly speaking, yes, they won't help you with the problems that are not part of League, outside of the fact that it is a League player.

The chat issues ... are automatically taken into consideration and you don't have any extra consideration for being a loud, even if extremely violated, victim.

Submitting a ticket is the only way to get someone to look into any matter. If you just report on the post game screen it'll be nothing more than a computer determining whether they broke the rules or not... I reported a player for saying "kys" in post game screen. He was still playing well after I reported it and based off his game history he did not receive any ban. The most he would have gotten is a chat restriction. Even though Riot themselves stated that if a player were to say "kys" it's grounds for a minimum of a 2 week suspension. 

The issue isn't whether I opened a ticket or not. It's the fact Riot doesn't take things like this seriously. They don't disclose the outcomes of the "punishments" because they don't punish everyone. The only time they actually punish someone is if they do it constantly. "It takes 20 games of being afk in a row to receive a permanent ban. I know because that's how many games it took for my account to get banned." - This is what a buddy of mine personally experienced. 

If them not revealing the "punishment" is not for that reason. Tell me what personal information does that give out. How does "Scarefish received a 2 week chat restriction due to toxicity." give out personal information?
Because it gives you the satisfaction that you took down a specific person. It's the same reason YouTube's axing cancel-culture.

Gives you satisfaction? So, you think if I report someone and I see they received a chat restriction you think I'll feel happy about it? Of course I would especially if they did something wrong. If someone runs it down in a game or tells another to kill themselves you don't think the person who reported it should be informed that their report actually did something? 

I've reported many different people and I've even opened a lot of tickets about people and many of them are, at the very least a 2 week suspension worth offenses. Out of all of those reports only a handful of them actually received a real punishment. When I open a ticket about someone I believe it requires an actual punishment. Thus I will check their game history every few days and after my ticket is "resolved" I see if they actually did anything. This is how I know they don't actually ban the people who ignore the rules.

I've opened tickets ranging from people saying "kys", threatening to dox others, running it down, and threatening to find someone in real life to assault them. Out of all of these reports only 2 people that said "kys" and a few of those who ran it down were banned. The rest did not receive a ban. 

So, basically me not knowing what happened to them is better? You know what that does? It discourages people from reporting. Go into any league game and ask the players "do you think riot will ban me if i run it down" I guarantee the majority of the players will say no.

I could not see if they received chat restriction but, I could see if they were playing. They played everyday after they "resolved" my ticket. 

Granted the other comments may not be "zero tolerance" however, the fact they allow players to say this with no punishment is the definition of stupidity. So basically I can't say "kys" but I am allowed to say "you don't deserve to live." 

As for him contacting me outside of game any defense with that? How about the threat of doxxing me?

Fact is Riot doesn't take matters like this seriously. If they did then we wouldn't be here right now.

So... Your personal experience is supposed to outweigh the plentiful example of cases that shows otherwise? You aren't guaranteed feedback on a reported player; people really should learn to move on.

Those are two different things. As bad as it sounds, they are different. One is actively telling someone to commit suicide, and the other isn't.

Contacting you outside of the game how? For clarity, specify this too please; outside of the match or outside of the game? Adding you to friends list is different than say facebook. It also depends on the medium of contact. For example, I'm in the boards Discord and anyone who happens to also be in it would be able to message me out of game because of another shared medium.  

Unless you actually get doxxed, that to me is as threatening as "My dad is CEO of Microsoft and is going to ban your Xbox account." if you actually get doxxed, then there is a security issue which would need to past Riot probably.

Your OPINION is that Riot doesnt take these matters seriously. Don't confuse opinion for fact though.

As for doxxing it's more than just fucking with someone's internet. It's also getting their personal information and releasing it.
